title: Deeply-Debiased Off-Policy Interval Estimation
abstract:
Abstract
Off-policy evaluation learns a target policy‚Äôs value with a historical dataset generated by a different behavior policy. In addition to a point estimate, many applications would benefit significantly from having a confidence interval (CI) that quantifies the uncertainty of the point estimate.
In this paper, we propose a novel deeply-debiasing procedure to construct an efficient, robust, and flexible CI on a target policy‚Äôs value.
Our method is justified by theoretical results and numerical experiments. A Python implementation
of the proposed procedure is available at https://github.com/RunzheStat/D2OPE.
